description:
Although we value experience and skills, we also care about who you are. We strive to surround ourselves with good people that share our values, that work hard, and that support each other as a team and as individuals.

Job Description

Kayne Anderson Rudnick Investment Management in Century City is seeking a highly motivated, organized, committed individual with strong initiative and excellent communication skills for the role of Operations Associate.

Kayne Investment Operations Department is responsible for the oversight of middle and back-office processing activities. With the exception of proxy voting, collateral management, and support of CRD Investment Book of Records (IBOR), most operations activities are outsourced to SS&C Technologies. Quality control is maintained through a written “runbook” of procedures and guidelines, as well as through monitoring of daily control reports and service-level agreement metrics.

Outsourced Activities Include

  • Settlements
  • Reconciliation
  • Corporate Actions
  • Pricing
  • Security Master Maintenance
  • Client reporting

Duties And Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with Senior Associates and Director of Operations to Support Investment Operations.
  • Review controls and enforce SLAs of 3rd back-office vendor.
  • Provide operational services to clients and internal constituents.
  • Oversee functions such as data integrity, trade settlement, investment accounting/reconciliations, proxy voting, corporate actions, monthly performance review
  • Support and maintain Charles River (OMS) IBOR accuracy.
  • Provide timely and accurate client statements reports on an ad hoc, monthly, quarterly, and annual basis.
  • Monitor technology vendors, connectivity with data sources, and assist with trouble shooting daily issues in various applications such as SalesForce (CRM), ISS Governance (Proxy), GWP (Accounting System/Data hub), GWPA (Performance), Pages (Client Statements Reporting), etc.
  • Being aware of technology needs and requirements to support ongoing regulatory and business environment changes (e.g., CSDR Regulation, North America T+1 shortened settlements cycle, SEC rulings on proxy, etc.)
  • Ensure internal processes and procedures holistically support all business segments (institutional, dual contract, wealth advisory, and wrap).
  • Onboard client accounts by reviewing and executing items associated with account setup, custodian, market openings for global accounts, client statement reporting, reconciliations, etc.

Minimum Qualifications

  • 3-5 years in investment operations capacity of a global investment strategies
  • Excellent understanding of OMS investment book of record (IBOR).
  • Aptitude to manage 3rd party vendor providing critical daily processing and systems.
  • Strong business judgment with the ability to work well with in cross functional teams.
  • Experience with trade operations, client statements, and investment accounting
  • Flexible, e.g., ability to adjust schedule to be available for meetings in global time zones as needed.
  • Proficient at Microsoft suite – Word, Outlook, PowerPoint, Excel, Teams.
  • Drive process improvements, standardization, and automation.
  • Critical thinker and makes sound judgement under uncertainty.
  • Work well with all levels of employees effectively.
  • Contribute thoughtfully and produce high-quality work.
  • Strong attention to detail.
  • Effective communications skills.
  • Comfortable working in an intense environment under tight deadlines.
  • Ability to quickly learn and excel at day-to-day responsibilities.
  • Anticipate multiple steps ahead when faced with complex issues or new situations.

In addition to Vacation, PTO benefits and a generous 401(k) company match, KAR is proud to offer its employees benefits:

  • Competitive Pay
  • Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
  • Life and Disability Insurance
  • Health Savings Account with a Company Match
  • Flexible Spending Accounts including Dependent Care
  • Wellness Program
  • Tuition Reimbursement
  • 24-Hour Employee Assistance Program
  • Adoption Assistance
  • Paid Family Care Time
  • Paid Volunteer days
  • Paid parking
  • Gym onsite
  • Fully stocked kitchen- lunch provided
  • Hybrid 3/2 remote (subject to change)

KAR is made up of diverse, talented, and passionate employees working together to achieve a common and rewarding goal: providing high quality investment strategies and wealth solutions for our clients. We are currently seeking candidates who possess the skills, vision, and determination to excel in their chosen fields.

Awarded Best Firm Culture at the 2022 PAM Awards, KAR maintains a team-oriented culture of accessibility, open communication, and respect. We believe in empowering and growing our people and are excited to be hiring.

KAR is an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or veteran status.

For additional general information on Kayne Anderson Rudnick, please access the firm’s web site at www.kayne.com.

Salary Range: $62,000- $85,000

The starting salary offer will vary based on the applicant’s education, experience, skills, abilities, geographic location, internal equity, and alignment with market data.
